body:
I am having a simliar issue when running the mlflow_create_experiment() function within R. 


"Error in process_initialize(self, private, command, args, stdin, stdout,  : 
  processx error: 'No such file or directory' at unix/processx.c:454"

Same here. 
```
Error in process_initialize(self, private, command, args, stdin, stdout,  : 
  Command not found
```
Any clue so far?

Same problem here, adding the `mlflow.exe` to the path as proposed by the issue linked by @Phlogi does not help. Maybe this is related to running on Windows, as the Github page says

> Note 2: We do not currently support running MLflow on Windows. Despite this, we would appreciate any contributions to make MLflow work better on Windows.
Hey, I am facing the same issue when I am trying to build a package from its source.

The command mlflow_ui() is working for me. I just get an error when running 

`library(mlflow)
writeLines("Hello world!", "output.txt") 
mlflow_log_artifact("output.txt") `

Hi Everyone,
I am running into the same error, I am trying out the [Quickstart](https://mlflow.org/docs/latest/quickstart.html) example using R and I get this error in all the lines where we access 'mlflow_.....' methods. (I am able to run using Python) 
Any help in this regard will be much appreciated.
System Info: [Win 10 64x, mlflow 0.9.0.1, Rstudio 1.2.1335, R x64 3.6.0]

Could you please upgrade to `mlflow 1.0.0` by running the following and retrying? From looking at the code, this should have been fixed already.

```
install.packages("mlflow")
```

Just try it again with `mlflow 1.0.0`, still errors: 

``` r
library(mlflow)

mlflow_set_experiment("Test")
#> Error in get_python_bin(): MLflow not configured, please run install_mlflow().

param1 = 12
mlflow_log_param("param1", 5)
#> Error in get_python_bin(): MLflow not configured, please run install_mlflow().

mlflow::mlflow_install()
#> Error: 'mlflow_install' is not an exported object from 'namespace:mlflow'

version
#>                _                           
#> platform       x86_64-w64-mingw32          
#> arch           x86_64                      
#> os             mingw32                     
#> system         x86_64, mingw32             
#> status                                     
#> major          3                           
#> minor          6.0                         
#> year           2019                        
#> month          04                          
#> day            26                          
#> svn rev        76424                       
#> language       R                           
#> version.string R version 3.6.0 (2019-04-26)
#> nickname       Planting of a Tree
```

<sup>Created on 2019-06-07 by the [reprex package](https://reprex.tidyverse.org) (v0.3.0)</sup>
@ldanai I believe you want to run `mlflow::mlflow_install()` instead of `mlflow::install_mlflow()`, I would also restart the R session after installing the updated `mlflow` package.

This is what i get with `mlflow::mlflow_install()`

``` r
library(mlflow)
mlflow::mlflow_install()
#> Error: 'mlflow_install' is not an exported object from 'namespace:mlflow'
```
and with `mlflow::install_mlflow()`

``` r
library(mlflow)
mlflow::install_mlflow()
# WARNING: The conda.compat module is deprecated and will be removed in a future release.
# Collecting package metadata: ...working... failed
# 
# CondaHTTPError: HTTP 000 CONNECTION FAILED for url <https://repo.anaconda.com/pkgs/msys2/win-64/repodata.json.bz2>
#   Elapsed: -
#   
#   An HTTP error occurred when trying to retrieve this URL.
# HTTP errors are often intermittent, and a simple retry will get you on your way.
# 
# If your current network has https://www.anaconda.com blocked, please file
# a support request with your network engineering team.
# 
# SSLError(MaxRetryError('HTTPSConnectionPool(host=\'repo.anaconda.com\', port=443): Max retries exceeded with url: /pkgs/msys2/win-64/repodata.json.bz2 (Caused by SSLError("Can\'t connect to HTTPS URL because the SSL module is not available."))'))
#> Error: Error 1 occurred creating conda environment r-mlflow-1.0.0
```

> @ldanai I believe you want to run `mlflow::mlflow_install()` instead of `mlflow::install_mlflow()`, I would also restart the R session after installing the updated `mlflow` package.

Ahh thanks @javierluraschi, I got that command function from some old docs. The installation works fine now :)

Now comes an errors below
``` r
library(mlflow)

mlflow_set_experiment("Test")
#> Error in process_initialize(self, private, command, args, stdin, stdout, : Command not found

param1 = 12
mlflow_log_param("param1", 5)
```

Installation also works fine for me but can't run any of the functions on windows. Reprex below.
Please let me know if there is any further details that would be helpful.

installed mlflow using:
```
install.packages("mlflow")
mlflow::install_mlflow()
```

Reprex
``` r
library(mlflow)

mlflow_set_experiment("Test")
#> Error in process_initialize(self, private, command, args, stdin, stdout, : Command not found

param1 <- 12
mlflow_log_param("param1", 5)
#> Error in process_initialize(self, private, command, args, stdin, stdout, : Command not found
```

<sup>Created on 2019-06-28 by the [reprex package](https://reprex.tidyverse.org) (v0.3.0)</sup>

So has there been any solution on this issue? I hit this issue today.
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not had recent activity. It will be closed if no further activity occurs. Thank you for your contributions.

Is there any solution to this issue; I face the same issue after installing mlflow as described in the quickstart here: https://www.mlflow.org/docs/latest/quickstart.html.

Installation works, tracking API does not seem to work however...

```{R}
> library(mlflow)
> 
> # Log a parameter (key-value pair)
> mlflow_log_param("param1", 5)
Error in rethrow_call(c_processx_exec, command, c(command, args), stdin,  : 
  Command not found @win/processx.c:977
> 
> # Log a metric; metrics can be updated throughout the run
> mlflow_log_metric("foo", 1)
Error in rethrow_call(c_processx_exec, command, c(command, args), stdin,  : 
  Command not found @win/processx.c:977
> mlflow_log_metric("foo", 2)
Error in rethrow_call(c_processx_exec, command, c(command, args), stdin,  : 
  Command not found @win/processx.c:977
> mlflow_log_metric("foo", 3)
Error in rethrow_call(c_processx_exec, command, c(command, args), stdin,  : 
  Command not found @win/processx.c:977
> 
> # Log an artifact (output file)
> writeLines("Hello world!", "output.txt")
> mlflow_log_artifact("output.txt")
Error in rethrow_call(c_processx_exec, command, c(command, args), stdin,  : 
  Command not found @win/processx.c:977
```
Thank you for interacting with this issue! Removing the stale label!

Update:
If you start an mlflow server via cmd prompt and then set_tracking_ui to your local host the tutorial works without error.

Step 1. 
cmd prompt (I used bash):
```
$mlflow server

c:\users\user\appdata\local\continuum\anaconda3\envs\r-mlflow-1.2.0\lib\site-packages\waitress\adjustments.py:435: DeprecationWarning: In future versions of Waitress clear_untrusted_proxy_headers will
be set to True by default. You may opt-out by setting this value to False, or opt-in explicitly by setting this to True.
DeprecationWarning
Serving on http://localhost:5000
```

Step 2.
R terminal (I used Jupyter):
```
mlflow_set_tracking_uri("http://localhost:5000")
```

Step 3. 
[r_wine tutorial](https://mlflow.org/docs/latest/tutorial.html)

Previous comment:
I'm running into the same issue with mlflow on windows when attempting the [r_wine tutorial](https://mlflow.org/docs/latest/tutorial.html). 

I can successfully write metrics and params to an existing mlflow server but when I attempt to set my tracking uri to a local file I get the Command not found error.

This works:
```
mlflow_set_tracking_uri("http://existing_mlflow_server")
```
This doesn't work:
```
mlflow_set_tracking_uri(uri = 'file:/mlruns/1')
```
